{{unreferenced|date=November 2008}} The '''Diego de Ocampo''' is the highest point in the [[Cordillera Septentrional]] in the [[Santiago Province (Dominican Republic)|Santiago Province]], [[Dominican Republic]].
== Etymology == This peak was named for Diego de Ocampo, a son of a wealthy Spaniard whose mother was of taino race from the island of Hispanola. He was named a true heir to his father in the Spanish courts. Diego de Ocampo rebelled, pillaged and sabotaged plantations in [[Concepción de la Vega]], [[San Juan de la Maguana]], [[Azua de Compostela]] and [[Baoruco Province|Bahoruco]]. He made a truce with the [[Real Audiencia of Santo Domingo|Spanish authorities]], but rebelled again soon after. Later on he was captured and executed by Spanish troops, according to Governor Cerrato and the [[Oidor]] Grajeada in 1546.
{{coord missing|Dominican Republic}}
[[Category:Geography of the Dominican Republic]] [[Category:Mountains of the Dominican Republic]]

{{Infobox mountain range | name = Doi Nang Non
ดอยนางนอน | photo = Doi Nang Non.JPG | photo_size = 270 | highest = [[Doi Tung]] | elevation_m = 1389 | elevation_note = [[Google Earth]] | listing = [[List of mountain ranges in the world named The Sleeping Lady]] | parent = [[Daen Lao Range]] | map = Thailand | map_caption = Thailand | label_position = right | label = Doi Nang Non | location = [[Mae Sai District]], [[Chiang Rai Province]], [[Thailand]] | coordinates = {{coord|20|21|06|N|99|50|30|E|type:mountain_region:TH_scale:100000|format=dms|display=inline,title}} | length_km = 30 | length_orientation= NNE/SSW | width_km = 7 | width_orientation = WNW/ESE | geology = [[Limestone]] | period = | easiest_route = From [[Mae Sai]] or [[Mae Chan Subdistrict|Mae Chan]] | photo_caption = The Doi Nang Non mountain range. When viewed from this angle, it is said to resemble a [[List of mountains named The Sleeping Lady|lady lying on her back]]. }} '''Doi Nang Non''' ({{lang-th|ดอยนางนอน}}, {{IPA-th|dɔ̄ːj nāːŋ nɔ̄ːn|pron}}; 'Mountain of the Sleeping Lady') is a mountain range in the [[Thai highlands]] in [[Chiang Rai Province]], [[Thailand]]. It is a [[Karst|karstic]] formation with numerous waterfalls and caves rising at the southern end of the [[Daen Lao Range]]. Part of its area is managed as the '''Tham Luang–Khun Nam Nang Non Forest Park''' ({{lang-th|วนอุทยานถ้ำหลวง-ขุนน้ำนางนอน}}). ==Geography== Doi Nang Non consists of a long hill tract that lies on the west side of the highway between [[Chiang Rai]] and [[Mae Sai Sub-district|Mae Sai]]. The greater part of the range is in [[Mae Sai District]], extending west and southwest of [[Pong Pha]] along the border with [[Myanmar]].[http://www.edtguide.com/DoiNangNon_65123 Doi Nang Non (ดอยนางนอน) - Location] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110710171510/http://www.edtguide.com/DoiNangNon_65123 |date=2011-07-10 }} The mountain range is an unusual land feature when seen from certain angles as its silhouette takes the shape of a reclining woman with long hair. Its highest point is [[Doi Tung]], which corresponds to the belly of the lady. ===Caves=== There are a number of caves and underground water courses in the range area. *'''[[Tham Luang Nang Non]]''' ({{lang-th|ถ้ำหลวงนางนอน}}; 'Great Cave of the Sleeping Lady') is a semi-dry{{efn|The cave is mostly dry throughout most of the year, but fills with water during the [[rainy season]].}} [[Solutional cave|limestone cave]] in the Doi Nang Non range.{{Cite web|url=http://www.onep.go.th/thailandnaturalsites/resourcedetail.php?geo_code=CR1&resourcetypecode=5|title=ถ้ำหลวงขุนน้ำนางนอน - เชียงราย|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Office of the Natural Resources and Environmental Policy and Planning (ONEP), [[Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment of Thailand]]|language=Thai|trans-title=Tham Luang Nang Non|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180705031819/http://www.onep.go.th/thailandnaturalsites/resourcedetail.php?geo_code=CR1&resourcetypecode=5|archive-date=2018-07-05|dead-url=no|access-date=|df=}} It is {{convert|10.3|km}} long, and has many deep recesses, narrow passages and tunnels winding under hundreds of meters of limestone strata.{{Cite web|url=http://www.onep.go.th/thailandnaturalsites/resourcedetail.php?geo_code=CR1&resourcetypecode=5|title=ถ้ำหลวงขุนน้ำนางนอน - เชียงราย|publisher=Office of the Natural Resources and Environmental Policy and Planning (ONEP), [[Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment of Thailand]]|language=Thai|trans-title=Tham Luang Khun Nam Nang Non - Chiang Rai|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180705031819/http://www.onep.go.th/thailandnaturalsites/resourcedetail.php?geo_code=CR1&resourcetypecode=5|archive-date=2018-07-05|dead-url=no|access-date=|df=}}There are numerous [[stalactites]] and [[stalagmites]] in some parts of the system. In 2018, Tham Luang was the site of [[Tham Luang cave rescue|a rescue operation]] to find and evacuate a local junior football team trapped inside. The cave was damaged during the operation. Authorities plan to rehabilitate the cave and its surrounding landscape, and have discussed plans of turning the area into a national park due to the increased tourist interest in it.{{Cite news | title=Tham Luang cave to be rehabilitated and upgraded into a national park | url=http://englishnews.thaipbs.or.th/tham-luang-cave-rehabilitated-upgraded-national-park/ | website=Thai PBS | date=4 July 2018}}{{Cite news | first=Sheena | last=McKenzie | title=Thai rescue drama cave likely to become tourist destination, officials say | url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/07/04/asia/thai-cave-tourist-destination-intl/index.html | work=[[CNN]] | date=4 July 2018}} *'''Khun Nam Nang Non''' ({{lang-th|ขุนน้ำนางนอน}}; 'Headwaters of the Sleeping Lady') is a natural pond into which water flows from the rocks above. This water is said to be the tears of the legendary lady's ghost. ==History== In 1986 an eight km2 sector of the range which included the entrance to the main cave was declared the Tham Luang–Khun Nam Nang Non Forest Park.[http://park.dnp.go.th/visitor/nationparkshow.php?PTA_CODE=4022 ถ้ำหลวง-ขุนน้ำนางนอน (วน.) (Tham Luang - Khun Nam Nang Non)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170908045457/http://park.dnp.go.th/visitor/nationparkshow.php?PTA_CODE=4022 |date=2017-09-08 }} ===2018 rescue operation=== {{main| Tham Luang cave rescue}} On 23 June 2018, a group of twelve boys aged between 11 and 17, who went to explore Tham Luang Nang Non with their assistant football coach, aged 25, went missing. The group was found 10 days later. They were part of a local junior football team. The cave they entered became flooded. Thai Navy SEAL divers had been searching the caves ever since.[https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/power-line-put-in-thai-cave-to-help-search-for-missing-boys/2018/06/25/8cb52abc-78d8-11e8-ac4e-421ef7165923_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.3d5e23c090d4 "Flooding complicates cave search for Thai soccer team" ''Washington Post'', 26 June 2018] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180705032640/https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/power-line-put-in-thai-cave-to-help-search-for-missing-boys/2018/06/25/8cb52abc-78d8-11e8-ac4e-421ef7165923_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.3d5e23c090d4 |date=2018-07-05 }} Owing to heavy rain which further flooded the cave entrance, searches were periodically interrupted.[https://weather.com/news/trending/video/search-suspended-for-boys-in-flooded-cave-in-thailand "Search Suspended for Boys in Flooded Cave in Thailand" ''The Weather Channel'', 26 June 2018] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180629160947/https://weather.com/news/trending/video/search-suspended-for-boys-in-flooded-cave-in-thailand |date=29 June 2018 }} [[Royal Thai Navy|Thai NAVY]] divers soon got help from American, Australian, British, and Chinese divers, military members, and emergency personnel. {{Cite news|url=https://www.perthnow.com.au/news/world/australian-divers-ng-b88891340z|title=No rest for Aussie rescue divers|date=2018-07-09|work=PerthNow|access-date=2018-07-09|language=en-GB}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/thai-navy-seal-team-posts-touching-photo-during-international-effort-to-rescue-boys-from-cave/|title=Thai Navy SEAL team posts touching photo during international effort to rescue boys from cave|work=CBS News|access-date=2018-07-09}} The group was found alive on Monday evening, 2 July, according to a press release at 22:30. All 12 boys along with their coach were reported alive.{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=852311068290685&id=209845125870619 |date=2 July 2018 |title=Live!! 22.25 น. เจอแล้วจ้า เก็บภาพ ... ทุกอย่างไว้... |trans-title=Live !! 22:25 and then collect the picture ... everything ... |language=Thai |publisher=PR.Chiangrai ประชาสัมพันธ์จังหวัดเชียงราย [Chiangrai Public Relation Office] |accessdate=2 July 2018 }}{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/07/02/twelve-children-football-coach-found-alive-going-missing-thai/ |title=Thailand cave rescue: Junior football team found by British divers could remain underground for months |first1=Nicola |last1=Smith |first2=Victoria |last2=Ward |first3=Rob |last3=Crilly |date=3 July 2018 |work=The Telegraph }} They were found by British volunteer divers around 400 metres away from a spot nicknamed "Pattaya Beach", an elevated mound in the cave.{{cite news |url=https://www.bangkokpost.com/news/general/1496082/rescuers-hack-through-rock-less-than-500m-from-pattaya-beach |title=Rescuers hack through rock less than 500m from 'Pattaya beach' |work=Bangkok Post |date=2 July 2018 }} Food and medical supplies were delivered but a three hour-long journey, continued rains and mountainous terrain above the cave delayed their escape. On 8 July at 19:00 four of the boys had been rescued.{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-thailand-accident-cave/six-thai-schoolboys-rescued-from-flooded-cave-idUSKBN1JY02N |title=Six Thai schoolboys rescued from flooded cave |agency=Reuters |date=8 July 2018 }} By 10 July at 19:00, all of the boys and their coach had been rescued from the cave.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-44760896|title=Four more boys rescued from Thai cave|date=2018-07-09|work=BBC News|access-date=2018-07-10}} ==Legend== One of the legends goes that in ancient times a beautiful princess fell in love with a stable boy and became pregnant. Knowing their love was forbidden, they fled and went in the cave to rest. When the boy went in search of food, he was caught by the princess' father's army and killed. The distraught princess stabbed herself to death and the legend says her blood became the water that flows through the cave, while her body is the surrounding mountains, said to look like a sleeping woman.{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/spirit-of-mythical-princess-looms-over-thai-cave-crisis/2018/06/27/7feaa5a4-79f6-11e8-ac4e-421ef7165923_story.html|title=Spirit of mythical princess looms over Thai cave crisis|website=Washington Post}} ==Tourism== Some of the caves in the hill area have been developed as a tourist attraction. There is a viewpoint at [[Mae Chan District]], from where the "sleeping lady" can best be observed.[http://www.hotelsguidethailand.com/travel/travel_detail.php?l=en&code=1253 Doi Nang Non View Point] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110712222020/http://www.hotelsguidethailand.com/travel/travel_detail.php?l=en&code=1253 |date=2011-07-12 }} Local tour guides joke that Doi Nang Non would be "the highest mountain in the world", if only the supposed lady would get up and stand on her feet.{{cn|date=July 2018}} ==See also== *[[Doi Tung]] *[[Tham Luang cave rescue]] *[[List of mountains in Thailand]] * [[List of caves]] * [[Speleology]] ==Notes== {{notelist}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[https://www.bangkokpost.com/news/general/1494134/why-cave-search-is-so-tricky Why cave search is so tricky], ''Bangkok Post'' *[https://web.archive.org/web/20130323115629/http://www.chiangmai-chiangrai.com/sleeping_lady_legend.html The Sleeping Lady Legend] ([[waybacked]]) *[http://www.tourismchiangrai.com/?p=preview&id_travel=109 Chiang Rai Tourism] {{th icon}} *[http://www.zheza.com/index.php?a=blog&b=entry&uid=498057 Two of the Doi Nang Non legends] {{th icon}} [[Category:Anthropomorphic geographic features]] [[Category:Caves of Thailand]] [[Category:Daen Lao Range]] [[Category:Geography of Chiang Rai Province]] [[Category:Mountains of Thailand]] [[Category:Thai folklore]]

'''Edward "Ed" Harwood''' (born February 4, 1950) is an American inventor, entrepreneur, and one of the pioneers of [[aeroponics]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Say Hello To The (Soon To Be) World's Largest Indoor Vertical Farm|url=http://modernfarmer.com/2015/03/say-hello-to-the-soon-to-be-worlds-largest-indoor-vertical-farm/|website=modern farmer}}</ref> He is the founder of Aero Farm Systems, L.L.C. (AeroFarms), as well as the chief inventor of “Method and apparatus for aeroponic farming" (United States Patent No. 8,782,948). [[File:Ed_Harwood_Sailing.jpg|thumb|Ed Harwood]]
==Early life and education== Ed Harwood was born in Stoughton, Massachusetts. He attended [[Colorado State University]], where he received three separate degrees: a BS in microbiology, a BS in animal science, and an MS in animal science. Harwood then went on to receive his PhD in dairy science and artificial intelligence from the [[University of Wisconsin-Madison]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Edward Harwood|url=https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Edward_Harwood/info|website=Research Gate}}</ref>
==Career== Subsequent to working in dairy science in [[Madison, WI]], most notably as [[Chief Executive Officer]] (CEO) of Topline Waikato, Inc., a New Zealand milking equipment supplier, Harwood moved to Ithaca, NY to work at [[Cornell University]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ed Harwood|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/person/ed-harwood#/entity|website=CrunchBase}}</ref> In 2003, after serving as the Associate Director of Cornell Cooperative Extension, he built a prototype aeroponic system designed to grow vegetables indoors in a sustainable way, without pesticides. The advantages of the system, in comparison to traditional agriculture, include: less water usage, better air flow, and the ability to grow vegetables year round.<ref>{{cite web|title=Aeroponics: a piece of the urban farming jigsaw puzzle?|url=http://smallfarms.cornell.edu/2010/10/03/aeroponics-a-piece-of-the-urban-farming-jigsaw-puzzle/|website=Cornell Small Farms Program}}</ref> After experimenting to find the most suitable textiles for the system, a critical piece of the technology’s success, he settled on a durable microfleece cloth that could be reused.<ref>{{cite web|title=AeroFarms Plans to Grow 1.5 Million Pounds of Leafy Greens in the Middle of Newark|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/bw/articles/2014-10-30/aerofarms-plans-aeroponic-farm-in-newark-to-grow-leafy-greens|website=BloombergBusiness}}</ref>
In 2004, Harwood took his technology and launched the [[Ithaca, NY]] based farming venture GreatVeggies. He began selling lettuce to local grocers and restaurants.<ref>{{cite web|title=Vertical Farming in Masdar City? AeroFarms' Soil-less Solution|url=http://www.greenprophet.com/2010/05/aerofarms-vertical-farming/|website=Green Prophet}}</ref> After significant struggle finding investors interested in aeroponics, he received funding from the Quercus Trust and 21Ventures in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|title=Startup Profile: AeroFarms: Urban Agriculture Aeroponic Systems|url=http://seedstock.com/2011/03/29/startup-profile-aerofarms-systems-urban-agriculture-aeroponics/|website=Seedstock}}</ref> He renamed the company AeroFarms and transitioned his focus from selling lettuce to selling the patented systems to farmers and entrepreneurs.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sustainability Leadership Series to host discussion|url=http://theithacan.org/news/college-briefing-feb-5/|website=The Ithacan}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Aeroponics Shapes Future of Urban Ag|url=http://www.urbanfarmonline.com/urban-farm-news/2010/11/05/aeroponics-shapes-urban-ag-future.aspx|website=Urban Farm Online}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Aerofarms Raises 500,000 in Seed Funding|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20100208006298/en/AeroFarms-Raises-500000-Seed-Funding|website=Business Wire}}</ref>
Harwood's first notable success as CEO of AeroFarms came in 2010 when he and EcoVeggies partnered with Phillip's Academy Charter School in [[Newark, NJ]].<ref>{{cite web|title=A Crop Sprouts Without Soil or Sunshine|url=http://green.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/09/20/a-crop-sprouts-without-soil-or-sunshine/|website=The New York Times}}</ref> One of Harwood’s patented aeroponic systems was placed in a science classroom as part of the school's EcoSPACES program, with the goal of helping students learn about sustainable growing techniques. The aeroponic system is currently located in the cafeteria, steps from the salad bar.<ref>{{cite web|title=New Jersey's 'Brick City' just broke ground on the world's largest vertical farm|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/aerofarms-newark-vertical-farming-opening-2015-7|website=Business Insider}}</ref> The leafy-green vegetables grown by the students are used in the school kitchen to prepare nutritious and healthy meals for the kids.<ref>{{cite web|title=For these students, lunch is personal|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/vertical-farming-for-these-students-lunch-is-personal/|website=CBS News}}</ref> In April 2016, as part of her [[Let's Move]] initiative, Michelle Obama visited Phillip's Academy and was shown the aeroponic system by the students before eating a meal next to it in the cafeteria.<ref>{{cite web|title=Michelle Obama Visits Newark School On National Garden Tour|url=http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2016/04/07/michelle-obama-newark-garden/|website=CBS New York}}</ref>
After receiving awards in 2010 and 2011, including the Red Herring Global Top 100 North America award and World Technology Award for the Environment, Harwood and AeroFarms accepted investment from other partners, including Goldman Sachs, Prudential and the city of Newark.<ref>{{cite web|title=In Newark, a Vertical Indoor Farm Helps Anchor and Area's Revival|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/08/realestate/commercial/in-newark-a-vertical-indoor-farm-helps-anchor-an-areas-revival.html|website=The New York Times}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The World Technology Summit & Awards 2011|url=http://wtn.net/summit2011/finalists.html|website=WTN}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=2010 Red Herring North America Top 100|url=http://www.redherring.com/events/rhna/2010-red-herring-top-100-north-america/|website=Red Herring}}</ref> In early 2014, AeroFarms broke ground on the world's largest indoor vertical farm, a 70,000-square-foot, $39 million facility located in a former steel mill in Newark.<ref>{{cite web|title=Green Pie In The Sky? Vertical Farming Is On The Rise In Newark|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2015/08/05/429345848/green-pie-in-the-sky-vertical-farming-is-on-the-rise-in-newark|website=NPR}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=World's Largest Indoor Vertical Farm is Coming to Newark|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/worlds-largest-indoor-vertical-farm-coming-newark-n389761|website=NBC News}}</ref> The record breaking farm will grow vegetables using the aeroponic system patented by Harwood, who currently serves as [[Chief Science Officer]] of AeroFarms.
[[Ian Frazier]], in [[The New Yorker]], likened Harwood's invention to the Wright brothers' first bi-plane, stating: "For concentrated ingenuity and handcrafted uniqueness, its closest simile, I think, is the Wright brothers’ first biplane, the Flyer, now on display in the National Air and Space Museum, in Washington. Like the Flyer, and like many other great inventions, Harwood’s prototype is also an objet d’art." <ref>{{cite web|title=The Vertical Farm|url=http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/01/09/the-vertical-farm|website=The New Yorker}}</ref> On June 25, 2018, Harwood was awarded the United FreshTEC Achievement Award for outstanding technical achievements by the United Fresh Produce Association for advancing “the fresh produce industry through innovation in indoor growing technologies.” <ref>{{cite web|title=United Fresh To Recognize Industry Leaders With 2018 United FreshTEC and United FreshMKT Achievement Awards|url=http://www.unitedfreshshow.org/news/united-fresh-to-recognize-industry-leaders-with-2018-united-freshtec-and-united-freshmkt-achievement-awards|website=United Fresh}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.aerofarms.com Aerofarms] *[http://www.pacsnewark.org Philip's Academy] *[http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/01/09/high-rise-greens The Vertical Farm]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Harwood, Edward}} [[Category:Aeroponics]] [[Category:Horticulture and gardening]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1950 births]]

'''Fire history''', the ecological science of the study of the history of wildfires, is a subdiscipline of [[fire ecology]]. Patterns of forest fires in historical and prehistorical time provide information relevant to the pattern of vegetation in modern landscapes. It provides an estimate of the historical range of variability of a natural disturbance regime, and can be used to identify the processes affecting the occurrence of fire. Fire history reconstructions are achieved by compiling atlases of past fires, using the [[tree ring]] record from fire scars and tree ages, and the charcoal record from soils and sediments.
== Prehistoric fires == Sustained wildfire can only exist once oxygen levels and fuel sources were present in sufficient quantities. Between 400 and 450 million year ago, fire became a feature of the landscape.<ref name="Pyne2001">{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/757509384|title=Fire : a brief history|last=1949-|first=Pyne, Stephen J.,|date=2001|publisher=University of Washington Press|isbn=029598144X|location=Seattle|oclc=757509384}}</ref>{{rp|11–14}} The presence of [[fusain]] (fossil charcoal), beginning in the early [[Carboniferous]] attests to this fire history and forms an important element of the [[Cretaceous–Paleogene boundary]].<ref name="Pyne2001" />{{rp|11–14}}<ref>{{Cite journal|date=2000-12-01|title=The Pre-Quaternary history of fire|url=https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0031018200001929|journal=Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology, Palaeoecology|volume=164|issue=1-4|pages=281–329|doi=10.1016/S0031-0182(00)00192-9|issn=0031-0182}}</ref>
==Mapped data== {{See also|Fire regime#Mapping fire regimes}} {{empty-section|date=January 2018}}
==Tree-ring data== {{refimprove section|date=January 2018}} [[File:PiceaAbiesWoodsample.jpg|thumb|241x241px|Tree core sample collected with an increment boarer]] [[File:Fire scarred Ponderosa pine (7204159758).jpg|thumb|241x241px|A cat-face fire scar on a [[ponderosa pine]]]] [[File:Fire scars in Pinus ponderosa crosscut.jpg|thumb|241x241px|A cross section of a ponderosa pine fire scar showing several dated fire events]] The growth record of a tree in seasonal climates is preserved in the growth rings in the stem wood; the field of [[dendrochronology]] is the study of the record of climate and other events preserved in the growth record. Each growth ring represents one year of life. The thickness of each ring indicates the amount of wood produced during that growing season. At the beginning of the growing season large cells are able to quickly divide creating a light colored wood. When growth slows down, generally in colder months, a darker wood is created from smaller cells dividing more slowly. Thus, one year is represented by a light inner ring and a darker outer ring.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theforestacademy.com/tree-knowledge/annual-growth-rings/#.Whs6c0qnFhF|title=Annual growth rings {{!}} Tree knowledge {{!}} Booklet {{!}} Forest Academy - Domtar|website=www.theforestacademy.com|language=en|access-date=2017-11-26}}</ref>
Rings can be counted from dead trees as well as stumps left behind from logging. A sample can be collected from a living tree using tools like the [[increment borer]]. The increment borer is a hollow steel tube used to extract a core sample from a tree’s trunk. The growth rings in a core sample are counted to determine the age of that tree. Ages of stand-replacing fires may be determined by determining the cohort-age of trees that established after a fire. For example, tree-ring dating of large stands will show the age of the forest, and may provide an estimate of when the last large disturbance event occurred.
Sometimes growth rings exhibit scars. A fire scar forms when heat kills the vascular cambium beneath the bark, which then heals over subsequent years as growth rings curl over the scarred area, thus protecting the tree from infection.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.fs.fed.us/rmrs/science-spotlights/making-scar-how-fire-scars-develop-trees|title=The making of a scar: How fire scars develop in trees {{!}} Rocky Mountain Research Station|website=www.fs.fed.us|language=en|access-date=2017-11-26}}</ref> This method can be used to date the year a fire occurred. Observing the scars establishes the timeline of a forest fire and the time between fires at a site. Surveying many trees over a large sample area provides a view to individual fire events and the overall fire regime. Not all tree species scar and show evidence of fire. Most pine species in the subgenus [[List of Pinus species#Subgenus Pinus|Pinus]] readily produce scars that are protected by resin; such scarring on other trees may result in death, leaving no fire record behind.
===Research and data examples=== Prior to Euro-American settlement in western North America, fire histories from scars preserved in ponderosa pine forests often reveal a pattern of frequent fire (often with 5 to 20 year intervals in a single area), with a pattern in time and space strongly related to past variations in climate.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Falk|first=Donald A|last2=Heyerdahl|first2=Emily K|last3=Brown|first3=Peter M|last4=Farris|first4=Calvin|last5=Fulé|first5=Peter Z|last6=McKenzie|first6=Donald|last7=Swetnam|first7=Thomas W|last8=Taylor|first8=Alan H|last9=Van Horne|first9=Megan L|date=2011-10-01|title=Multi-scale controls of historical forest-fire regimes: new insights from fire-scar networks|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1890/100052/abstract|journal=Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment|language=en|volume=9|issue=8|pages=446–454|doi=10.1890/100052|issn=1540-9309}}</ref> Fuel reduction from grazing and fire suppression greatly reduced the amount of fire in dry forests over the last 100 years.
A study by Arne Buechiling and William L. Baker in 2004 identified 41 fire events beginning in 1533 in a 9200-ha study area north of Estes Park, Colorado. They sampled 3461 tree cores and 212 fire scars.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Buechling|first=Arne|last2=Baker|first2=William L.|date=2004|title=A fire history from tree rings in a high-elevation forest of Rocky Mountain National Park|url=http://cjfr.nrc.ca/|journal=Canadian Journal of Forest Research|volume=34|pages=1259–1273|via=}}</ref> Fire scar data provided greater insight into the fire event parameters. Of the 41 fires, 22 where high-severity crown fires, 7 low-severity surface fires, and 8 mixed-severity fires. Fires larger than 300 ha were few, but composed a substantial proportion of the area burned since 1700. Drought periods led to larger fires.
There is little known about the fire history in some places. Central Europe for instance has a lack of intact forests with old growth trees or an abundance of dead or cut down trees that can be used to reconstruct the past fire regimes. An exception to this lacking history is the [[Białowieża Forest|Bialowieza Primeval Forest]] in Poland.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Niklasson|first=Mats|last2=Zin|first2=Ewa|last3=Zielonka|first3=Tomasz|last4=Feijen|first4=Markus|last5=Korczyk|first5=Adolf F.|last6=Churski|first6=Marcin|last7=Samojlik|first7=Tomasz|last8=Jedrzejewska|first8=Bogumiła|last9=Gutowski|first9=Jerzy M.|date=2010|title=A 350-year tree-ring fire record from Białowie_za Primeval Forest, Poland: implications for Central European lowland fire history|url=|journal=Journal of Ecology|volume=98|pages=1319–1329|via=}}</ref> A group of researchers were able to use a 350-year tree-ring fire record to reconstruct the fire history in precise detail. This is a shining example of how the method can be used in a place with lost or no written history of a fire regime.
== See also == * [[Fire ecology]] * [[Pyrogeography]] * [[Fossil record of fire]]
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Ecological succession]] [[Category:Fire]] [[Category:Landscape ecology]]

{{Infobox building | name = Fordsburg Square | native_name = | native_name_lang = | former_names = | alternate_names = | status = | image = Fordsburg Toilets historic.jpg | image_alt = | image_size = | caption = The toilets are the only building remaining from the battle | map_type = | map_alt = | map_caption = | relief = | altitude = | building_type = Municipal square | architectural_style = | structural_system = | cost = | ren_cost = | client = | owner = | current_tenants = | landlord = | location = | address = Mint Road, Fordsburg | location_town = Johannesburg | location_country = South Africa | coordinates = {{coord|-26.20477|28.0209|region:US-SA|display=inline,title}} | groundbreaking_date = | start_date = | completion_date = | opened_date = | inauguration_date = | renovation_date = | demolition_date = | destruction_date = | observatory = | other_dimensions = | floor_count = | floor_area = | seating_type = | seating_capacity = | elevator_count = | architect = | architecture_firm = | structural_engineer = | services_engineer = | civil_engineer = | other_designers = | quantity_surveyor = | main_contractor = | awards = | designations = | ren_architect = }}
'''Fordsburg Square''' in [[Fordsburg]] is a thriving square that is the site of a [[flea market]] was recently known for being run-down. This square in [[Johannesburg]] is the location of a battle between striking miners and the South African police, army and air force.
==Description== Fordsburg Square is the site of a [[flea market]] that was known for being run-down.
==History==
{{main|Rand Rebellion}} The [[Rand Rebellion]] against the powers of law and order ended here on the 14 March 1922.<ref name=blueplaque/> The uprising came out of a strike of black gold miners that started on `1 January 1922 in response to five shilling wage cut per shift. The White workers joined them ten days later because the owners of the mine had decided to cut costs by employing (cheaper) more black miners instead of the existing white workers.<ref name=miners>{{cite web|last=Human & Rousseau|title=Coal Miners Strike on the Rand|url=http://www.sahistory.org.za/dated-event/coal-miners-strike-rand|publisher=South Africa History Online|accessdate=20 June 2013}}</ref>
The workers did not just withdraw their labour but the a portion of the 20,000 white workers and the 180,000 black miners took over areas of Johannesburg and they were in control of [[Benoni, Gauteng|Benoni]], [[Brakpan]] suburbs of [[Fordsburg]] and [[Jeppestown|Jeppe]]. The strike had become an open rebellion and on the 15 March the army was called to bombard the Fordsburg square which was deemed the stronghold of the rebels.<ref name=squarefalls>{{cite web|title=The Rand Revolt strikers' stronghold at Fordsburg Square falls to the government|url=http://www.sahistory.org.za/dated-event/rand-revolt-strikers039-stronghold-fordsburg-square-falls-government|publisher=South African History Online|accessdate=20 June 2013}}</ref> By this time the rebels had dug substantial [[World War One]] trenches across the square. Even the [[South African Air Force]] was called to bomb this square but they hit the nearby Mint Road [[Presbyterian Church]].<ref name=blueplaque>{{cite web|title=Home » Battle of Fordsburg Square - 14 March 1922 Battle of Fordsburg Square - 14 March 1922|url=http://www.blueplaques.co.za/content/battle-fordsburg-square-14-march-1922|publisher=blueplaques.co.za|accessdate=20 June 2013}}</ref>
==Today== One of the buildings that offered protection to the rebels was the municipal toilets and these are still standing and in use. In 2013 a Blue Plaque was added to the size of that building to commemorate the role that the square took in the [[History of South Africa]].<ref name=blueplaque/>
==References== {{commonscat}} {{reflist}}
[[Category:Geography of Johannesburg]] [[Category:Squares in South Africa]]

page.title: Foreign relations of the Democratic Federation of Northern Syria

revision.text:
{{Politics of the Democratic Federation of Northern Syria}}
The '''foreign relations of the Democratic Federation of Northern Syria''' refers to the external relations of the self-proclaimed autonomous region of the [[Democratic Federation of Northern Syria]] (DFNS). The region, consisting of three regions ([[Afrin Region|Afrin]], [[Euphrates Region|Euphrates]] and [[Jazira Region|Jazira]]) was formed in early 2014 in the context of the [[Syrian Civil War]], a conflict that has caused the involvement of many different countries and international organizations in the area.
The [[Constitution of the Democratic Federation of Northern Syria]], which defines the DFNS as an integral part of [[Syria]] and not a separate country, states that "the Autonomous Regions shall not interfere in the domestic affairs of other countries, and it shall safeguard its relations with neighboring states, resolving any conflicts peacefully." It also mandates, among other executive council bodies, a Body of Foreign Relations.<ref>{{cite wikisource|Constitution of the Rojava Cantons|date=2014}}</ref>
== Foreign relations of the Democratic Federation of Northern Syria ==
=== Relations with UN member states === {{see also|Syrian Democratic Forces#Support by the United States, France and other Western nations}} *{{flagicon|Albania}} '''[[Albania]]''' – Albania is one of the main sources of weapons flowing to the [[People's Protection Units]] (YPG) in the DFNS through the [[Military intervention against ISIL#3 December 2014|US-led coalition against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]].<ref name=hobnob /> *{{flagicon|Belgium}} '''[[Belgium]]''' – In September 2016, the 8th conference of the DFNS's leading [[Democratic Union Party (Syria)|Democratic Union Party]] (PYD) was held in [[City of Brussels|Brussels]]. 500 PYD members, including its leaders, and many others (including [[Abdul Rahman Haji Ahmadi]]) attended.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.hawarnews.com/the-8th-conference-of-pyd-held-in-europe/|title=The 8th conference of PYD held in Europe|publisher=[[Hawar News Agency]]|date=24 September 2016}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Czech Republic}} '''[[Czech Republic]]''' – The YPG opened an official representation office in [[Prague]] in April 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://praguemonitor.com/2016/04/04/kurdish-militia-ypg-opens-office-prague |title=Kurdish militia YPG opens office in Prague |publisher=[[Prague Daily Monitor]] |date=2016-04-04 |accessdate=2017-03-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/03/syrian-kurdish-forces-inaugurate-first-representation-office-czech-republic/|title=Syrian Kurdish forces to inaugurate first representation office in Czech Republic|work=[[ARA News]] |date=31 March 2016}}</ref> The relationship with the YPG on particular has been described as "amicable", and "Czech Defense Ministry and other officials are said to regularly hobnob with YPG cadres."<ref name=hobnob>{{cite web|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/11/turkey-czech-arrest-terrorists-kurdish-sirnak-ypg.html|title=News of arrests of YPG-linked Czechs shocks Turkey|work=[[Al-Monitor]] |date=17 November 2016}}</ref> The Czech Republic is one of the main sources of weapons flowing to the YPG through the US-led coalition against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant.<ref name=hobnob /> The office was shut down on December 2016.<ref>{{cite web|author=Medin |first=Joakim |url=http://aranews.net/2016/12/kurdish-ypg-office-prague-shut/ |title=Kurdish YPG office in Prague shut down |publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-12-14 |accessdate=2017-03-02}}</ref> [[Salih Muslim Muhammad|Salih Muslim]], then foreign relations official of the [[Movement for a Democratic Society]] (TEV-DEM) coalition, was briefly detained at Turkey’s request on 25 February 2018 in [[Prague]], the capital of the Czech Republic, but was released two days later, drawing angry protests from Turkey.<ref>{{cite web|title=Czechs release Syrian Kurdish leader, won't extradite to Turkey|url=https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2018/02/detained-turkish-pyd-leader-freed-prague.html|work=Al Monitor|date=27 February 2018}}</ref> On 17 March 2018, the Czech authorities dismissed Turkey's request.<ref>{{cite web|title=Czech’s drop Salih Müslim extradition case|url=https://ahvalnews.com/salih-muslim/czechs-drop-salih-muslim-extradition-case|work=Ahval News|date=18 March 2018}}</ref> *{{Flagicon|Finland}} '''[[Finland]]''' – According to ''[[Suomen Kuvalehti]]'' magazine, Finland is planning on giving the DFNS support for developing government and rebuilding infrastructure.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Pesonen|first1=Hannu|title=Tätä naista Isis vihaa kuin ruttoa - Suomenkuvalehti.fi|url=http://suomenkuvalehti.fi/jutut/kotimaa/tata-naista-isis-vihaa-kuin-ruttoa/?shared=79247-f338c9f5-500|website=[[Suomen Kuvalehti]] |language=fi-FI|date=29 April 2015}}</ref> *{{Flagicon|France}} '''[[France]]''' – In May 2016, the administration of the DFNS opened a representation office in [[Paris]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2016/05/24/Syrian-Kurds-open-unofficial-representative-mission-in-Paris-.html|title=Syrian Kurds open unofficial representative mission in Paris|publisher=[[Al Arabiya]] |date=2016-05-24|access-date=2016-05-22}}</ref> In February 2015, President [[Francois Hollande]] met with the PYD co-leader [[Asya Abdullah]] and the [[Women's Protection Units]] (YPJ) commander Nesrin Abdullah in the [[Elysee Palace]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2015/02/turkey-france-kurdish-guerillas-elysee.html#|title=Hollande-PYD meeting challenges Erdogan|work=[[Al-Monitor]]|date=12 February 2015}}</ref> [[Special Operations Command (France)|French Special Operations Command Forces]] are supporting the [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] in operations.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://en.rfi.fr/france/20160609-france-admits-special-forces-are-advising-syrian-rebels |title= France admits special forces are advising Syrian rebels |publisher=[[Radio France Internationale]] |date=9 June 2016 |accessdate= 10 June 2016}}</ref> In August 2016, a French delegation and the People’s Municipality Board in the DFNS signed a contract to open a center in the Kurdish and French languages in order to bring the cultures of the DFNS and France together, and the opening of a branch of the Paris 8 University in the DFNS was also discussed.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.nrttv.com/EN/Details.aspx?Jimare=9371|title=French delegation seeks to open cultural center in Rojava|publisher=[[NRT News]] |date=2016-08-09 |accessdate= 2016-08-09}}</ref> In May 2017, Hollande received the co-chairman of the PYD, [[Salih Muslim Muhammad|Salih Muslim]], for talks on the Syria situation.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nrttv.com/en/Details.aspx?Jimare=14386|title=PYD leader Salih Muslim meets French President at Elysee Palace|publisher=[[NRT News]]|date=10 May 2017}}</ref> On 29 March 2018, French President [[Emmanuel Macron]] vowed to send troops to Syria's [[Manbij]] in a bid to assist local [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] militias in preventing Turkish forces from advancing on the town.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/international/afrin-emmanuel-macron-recoit-une-delegation-du-rojava-29-03-2018-7636626.php|title=Syrie : Emmanuel Macron annonce l’envoi de soldats au secours des Kurdes|publisher=Le Parisien|language=French|date=29 March 2018}}</ref> French troops then moved into SDF-controlled towns of [[Manbij]] and [[Rmelan]] in the first days of April.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.mintpressnews.com/first-french-ground-troops-arrive-in-northern-syria/240077/|title=First French Ground Troops Arrive in Northern Syria |publisher=Mintpress|date=5 April 2018}}</ref> [[File:Salih_Muslim_%26_Ulla_Jelpke.jpg|thumb|[[Salih Muslim]], then co-chairman of the [[Democratic Union Party (Syria)|PYD]], with [[Ulla Jelpke]] at [[Rosa Luxemburg Foundation]] in [[Berlin]]]] *{{flagicon|Germany}} '''[[Germany]]''' – In May 2016, the DFNS administration opened a representation office in [[Berlin]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.evrensel.net/haber/279449/berlinde-rojava-temsilciligi-acildi |title=Berlin’de Rojava temsilciliği açıldı |publisher=[[Evrensel]] |date=7 May 2016 |language=Turkish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.jungewelt.de/2016/05-09/021.php |title=Rojava-Vertretung in Deutschland |language=German | publisher=[[Junge Welt]] |date=9 May 2016}}</ref> In August 2016, Foreign Minister [[Frank-Walter Steinmeier]] condemned Turkish attacks against the [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] and pointed out that Turkey has to join the war against the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] (ISIL), "not to fight Syrian Kurds".<ref name="Iraqi News">{{cite web|url=http://www.iraqinews.com/baghdad-politics/germany-warns-turkey-attacking-kurds-syria/|title=Germany warns Turkey from attacking Kurds in Syria|work=Iraqi News|date=28 August 2016}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Greece}} '''[[Greece]]''' – The co-chairman of the PYD, [[Salih Muslim Muhammad|Salih Muslim]], has been an official guest of Greek prime minister [[Alexis Tsipras]]' governing [[Syriza]] party at their congress in October 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://twitter.com/gargamelbeg/status/786656764171325440|title=Kurdish leaders @hdpdemirtas and @serokepyd are at @syriza_gr congress with @atsipras|website=Twitter |date=2016-10-13|accessdate=2016-10-13}}</ref> In February 2016, Muslim attended the [[Abdullah Öcalan|Öcalan]] Conference in Athens.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://ekurd.net/kurdish-pyd-hdp-ocalan-athens-2016-02-17|title=Syrian Kurdish PYD, Turkey’s HDP leaders attend ‘Ocalan conference’ in Athens|publisher=eKurd|date=17 February 2016|accessdate=2016-10-13}}</ref> * {{Flagicon|Iraq}} '''[[Iraq]]''' – {{Flagicon|Iraqi Kurdistan}} '''[[Iraqi Kurdistan]]''' – The DFNS shares much culturally with Iraqi Kurdistan, an autonomous region of [[Iraq]], but has many political differences. There has been military cooperation with [[Iraqi Kurdistan]] and the United States in the conflict against ISIL, although neither gives official support for the DFNS or the YPG. The [[Kurdistan Regional Government]], which the [[Kurdistan Democratic Party]] runs, is an ally of Turkey and has co-operated to enforce a unilateral economic blockade against Rojava which has damaged and limited the DFNS's economy. The "Sultanistic system" of Iraqi Kurdistan<ref>{{cite web|url=http://carnegie-mec.org/2015/08/17/kurdistan-s-politicized-society-confronts-sultanistic-system/ieta|title=Kurdistan’s Politicized Society Confronts a Sultanistic System|publisher=[[Carnegie Middle East Center]]|date=2015-08-18|accessdate=2016-06-08}}</ref> stands in stark contrast to the [[Democratic Confederalism|Democratic Confederalist]] system of the DFNS. * {{Flagicon|Italy}} '''[[Italy]]''' – In June 2015, YPJ commander Nesrin Abdullah was invited to speak in the Italian parliament.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://jinha.com.tr/en/ALL-NEWS/content/view/25309|title=YPJ Commander Nesrin Abdullah speaks in Italian Parliament|publisher=JINHA|date=2015-06-23|accessdate=2016-06-09}}</ref> In July 2016, the co-chairperson of the PYD, [[Asya Abdullah]], held talks with a number of senior government officials in Rome.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.hawarnews.com/asya-abdulla-meets-senior-officials-in-rome/|title=Asya Abdulla meets senior officials in Rome|publisher=[[Hawar News Agency]]|date=2016-07-04|accessdate=2016-07-09}}</ref> * {{flagicon|Japan}} '''[[Japan]]''' – In April 2017, a delegation from the Federation of Northern Syria made a 6-day visit to [[Tokyo]]. The delegation includes Co-chairman of Constituent Council of Democratic Federation of Northern Syira [[Hediya Yousef]], the spokeswoman of [[Kongreya Star]] Avin Siwed, head of the [[Kurdish National Alliance in Syria]] Mustafa Mashayikh, and member of [[Kurdish National Congress]]'s Executive Council Rafiq Jaifar.<ref name=anha>{{cite web|url=http://ku.hawarnews.com/sandeyek-ji-rojava-li-japonya-ye/|title=Şandeyek ji Rojava li Japonya ye|work=ANHA|date=26 April 2017}}</ref><ref name=日本クルド友好協会>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpn-krd.org/jpn/report/170427-2.pdf|title=会見者のご案内|work=日本クルド友好協会|date=27 April 2017}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Netherlands}} '''[[Netherlands]]''' – In September 2016, the DFNS administration opened a representation office in [[The Hague]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/09/syrian-kurds-inaugurate-representation-office-in-the-netherlands/|title=Syrian Kurds inaugurate representation office in the Netherlands|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-09-08|accessdate=2016-09-08}}</ref> *{{flagicon|Norway}} '''[[Norway]]''' – In November 2016, the city of Oslo in its City Hall hosted a "New World Embassy" event dedicated to the DFNS, "After Belonging", bringing representatives from the DFNS together with international politicians, diplomats, academics, journalists, students, artists, and more.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.e-flux.com/announcements/78967/oslo-architecture-triennale-2016after-belonging/|title=After Belonging. New World Embassy: Rojava|publisher=Oslo Architecture Triennale 2016s|accessdate=2016-11-25}}</ref> *{{Flagicon|Russia}} '''[[Russia]]''' – In February 2016, the DFNS administration opened a representation office in [[Moscow]] amid growing ties between Russia and the DFNS.<ref>{{cite news|title=Syrian Kurdish PYD opens office in Moscow|url=http://www.todayszaman.com/diplomacy_syrian-kurdish-pyd-opens-office-in-moscow_411986.html|agency=[[Today's Zaman]] |date=10 February 2016}}</ref> Russia has lent outstanding support to the DFNS in the diplomatic arena, in particular more clearly than any other country calling for its inclusion in the [[Geneva peace talks on Syria (2016)|Geneva III peace talks on Syria]], and to some degree carrying their positions into the talks, as documented in Russia's May 2016 draft for a new constitution for Syria.<ref name="Now.MMedia/Al-Akhbar">{{cite web|url=https://now.mmedia.me/lb/en/NewsReports/567021-russia-finishes-draft-for-new-syria-constitution-report|title=Russia finishes draft for new Syria constitution|publisher=Now.MMedia/Al-Akhbar|date=2016-05-24|accessdate=2016-05-24}}</ref> In the course of 2017, representatives of the YPG appeared with representatives of the Russian military on Russian military bases in Syria, sporting the flags of both Russia and the YPG.<ref name=russia>{{cite web|url=https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2017/12/turkey-syria-kurds-move-closer-russia.html|title=Syrian Kurds move closer to Russia|publisher=Al Monitor|date=7 December 2017}}</ref> As of late 2017, a delegation of the Democratic Federation of Northern Syria has been invited to attend the Syrian National Dialogue Congress in Sochi in February 2018.<ref name=russia /> * {{Flagicon|Spain}} '''[[Spain]]''' – {{Flagicon|Catalonia}} '''[[Catalonia]]''' – In July 2014 the [[Democratic Union Party (Syria)|PYD]] co-chair [[Salih Muslim]] was invited by the [[Catalan Parliament]] in [[Barcelona]] to explain the democratic process in the DFNS. He met with the president of the Parliament, [[Núria de Gispert]], and representatives of four major Catalan parties.<ref>{{cite web|title=Salih Muslim speaks in Catalonia: Europe is breeding jihadists|url=http://www.diclehaber.com/en/news/content/view/412863?from=687033084|publisher=[[Dicle News Agency]] |date=30 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Turquia utilitza l'Estat Islàmic contra els kurds|url=http://www.elperiodico.cat/ca/noticias/internacional/turquia-utilitza-lestat-islamic-contra-els-kurds-3415280|publisher=[[El Periódico de Catalunya]] |date=29 July 2014}}</ref> *{{Flagicon|Sweden}} '''[[Sweden]]''' – In April 2016, the DFNS administration opened a representation office in [[Stockholm]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Name * |url=http://aranews.net/2016/04/syrian-kurds-inaugurate-representation-office-sweden/ |title=Syrian Kurds inaugurate representation office in Sweden |publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-04-18 |accessdate=2017-03-02}}</ref> [[File:Flags of Turkey and Rojava.png|thumb|Flags of Rojava and Turkey at a border crossing in northern Syria]] * {{Flagicon|Turkey}} '''[[Turkey]]''' – Neighbouring Turkey has received PYD co-chair [[Salih Muslim]] for talks in 2013<ref>{{cite web|title=PYD leader arrives in Turkey for two-day talks: Report|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/pyd-leader-arrives-in-turkey-for-two-day-talks-report.aspx?pageID=238&nID=51439&NewsCatID=338|publisher=[[Hürriyet Daily News]] |date=25 July 2013}}</ref> and in 2014,<ref>{{cite web|title=Syrian Kurdish leader holds secret talks in Turkey: reports|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/syrian-kurdish-leader-holds-secret-talks-turkey-reports-140034309.html|publisher=[[Yahoo! News]] |date=5 October 2014}}</ref> even entertaining the idea of opening a DFNS representation office in [[Ankara]] "if it's suitable with Ankara's policies."<ref>{{cite web|title=Salih Muslim’s trip to Turkey and Incirlik Base|url=http://www.yenisafak.com/en/columns/abdulkadirselvi/salih-muslims-trip-to-turkey-and-incirlik-base-2015919|publisher=[[Yeni Şafak]] |date=7 July 2015}}</ref> Nonwithstanding, [[Turkey]] is persistently hostile, because it feels threatened by the DFNS's emergence encouraging activism for autonomy among [[Kurds in Turkey]] and the [[Kurdish–Turkish conflict (1978–present)|Kurdish–Turkish conflict]], and in this context in particular the DFNS's leading [[Democratic Union Party (Syria)|Democratic Union Party]] (PYD) and the YPG militia being members of the [[Kurdistan Communities Union]] (KCK) network of organisations, which also includes both political and militant assertively Kurdish organizations in Turkey itself, including the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK). Turkey's policy towards the DFNS is based on an economic blockade,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/2016-10-14/rojava-model|title=The Rojava Model|author=Meredith Tax|publisher=[[Council on Foreign Relations]] |date=14 October 2016}}</ref> persistent attempts of international isolation,<ref name=OIC>{{cite web |url=http://www.mfa.gov.tr/speech-by-h_e_-mevlut-cavusoglu_-minister-of-foreign-affairs-of-the-republic-of-turkey-at-the-meeting-of-council-of-foreign-mini.en.mfa |title=Speech by H.E. Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Turkey at the Meeting of Council of Foreign Ministers of the 13th Islamic Summit of the OIC, 12 April 2016, İstanbul |publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Turkey)]]}}</ref> opposition to the cooperation of the international Anti-ISIL-coalition with DFNS militias,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkish-president-erdogan-slams-us-over-ypg-support.aspx?PageID=238&NID=99783&NewsCatID=510|title=Turkish President Erdoğan slams US over YPG support|work=[[Hürriyet Daily News]] |date=28 May 2016|accessdate=2016-11-02}}</ref> and support of [[Islamism|Islamist]] Syrian Civil War parties hostile towards the DFNS,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://lobelog.com/how-can-turkey-overcome-its-foreign-policy-mess/|title=How Can Turkey Overcome Its Foreign Policy Mess?|publisher=Lobolog (Graham E. Fuller)|date=2016-02-19|accessdate=2016-10-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jamestown.org/single/?tx_ttnews[tt_news]=44027|title=The Rise of Jaysh al-Fateh in Northern Syria|author=Wladimir van Wilgenburg|publisher=[[Jamestown Foundation]] |date=12 June 2015|accessdate=2016-10-28}}</ref> in past times even including ISIL.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/david-l-phillips/research-paper-isis-turke_b_6128950.html|title=Research Paper: ISIS-Turkey Links|author=David L. Phillips|publisher=[[The Huffington Post]] |date=11 September 2014|accessdate=2016-10-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/links-between-turkey-and-isis-are-now-undeniable-2015-7|title=Senior Western official: Links between Turkey and ISIS are now 'undeniable'|publisher=[[Business Insider]] |date=28 July 2015|accessdate=2016-10-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.meforum.org/5317/turkey-isis|title=Turkey's Double Game with ISIS|author=Burak Bekdil|publisher=[[Middle East Forum]] |date=Summer 2015|accessdate=2016-10-28}}</ref> Turkey has on several occasions also been militarily attacking DFNS territory and defence forces.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jul/27/turkey-shells-kurdish-held-village-in-syria|title=Turkey accused of shelling Kurdish-held village in Syria|work=[[The Guardian]] |date=27 July 2015|accessdate=2016-06-09}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/02/turkey-bombs-kurdish-city-of-afrin-northern-syria-civilian-casualties-reported/|title=Turkey strikes Kurdish city of Afrin northern Syria, civilian casualties reported|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=19 February 2016|accessdate=2016-06-09}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://europe.newsweek.com/turkeys-syria-intervention-sign-weakness-not-strength-501516|title=Turkey’s Syria Intervention: A Sign of Weakness Not Strength|author= Christopher Phillips|publisher=[[Newsweek]] |date=22 September 2016|accessdate=2016-10-28}}</ref> The latter has resulted in some of the most clearcut instances of international solidarity with the DFNS.<ref name="Iraqi News"/><ref name=Tastekin>{{cite web|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/09/turkey-syria-intervention-wreck-arab-kurdish-alliance.html|title=US backing ensures Arab-Kurd alliance in Syria will survive|author=Fehim Taştekin|publisher=[[Al-Monitor]] |date=9 September 2016|accessdate=2016-10-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://sputniknews.com/politics/201610211046579169-turkey-strikes-syria/|title=Moscow Concerned Over Turkish Airstrikes on Kurdish Positions in Syria - Lavrov|work=[[Sputnik (news agency)]] |date=21 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mccain.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2016/10/statement-by-sasc-chairman-john-mccain-on-turkish-government-attacks-on-syrian-kurds|title=Statement by SASC Chairman John McCain on Turkish Government Attacks on Syrian Kurds|author=U.S. Senator John McCain, Chairman of the United States Senate Armed Services Committee|date=27 October 2016}}</ref> In the perception of much of the Turkish public, the federal project of the DFNS as well as U.S. support for the YPG against ISIL are elements of a wider conspiracy scheme by a "mastermind" with the aim to weaken or even dismember Turkey, in order to prevent its imminent rise as a global power.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Tin-Foil Hats Are Out in Turkey. From Zionist plots to CIA conspiracies, Turkey’s favorite pastime is believing that the world is out to get it. |url=https://foreignpolicy.com/2016/09/12/the-tin-foil-hats-are-out-in-turkey/|publisher=[[Foreign Policy]] |date=12 September 2016}}</ref> Opposition leader [[Selahattin Demirtas]] has argued for Turkey and other countries to recognize the DFNS and work with it as a partner.<ref>{{cite web |title=HDP leader says Ankara has 'neither the power nor means' to eliminate Kurdish movement|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/01/turkey-pro-kurdish-party-leader-demirtas-pkk-tamil-tigers.html|publisher=[[Al-Monitor]] |date=2016-01-04|accessdate=2016-06-13}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=The U.S. should accept a Syrian Kurdish region, says Turkish opposition leader|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2016/05/02/the-u-s-should-accept-a-syrian-kurdish-state-says-turkish-opposition-leader/|publisher=[[The Washington Post]] |date=2016-05-02|accessdate=2016-06-13}}</ref> * {{Flagicon|United Kingdom}} '''[[United Kingdom]]''' – In January 2015, a [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|British Parliament]] committee asked the government of Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] to explain and justify its policy of not working with the DFNS's military in combating ISIL.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-a-z/commons-select/foreign-affairs-committee/news/report-kurdistan-region/|title=Build Kurdistan relationship or risk losing vital Middle East partner|date=21 January 2015|website=www.parliament.uk |publisher=[[Parliament of the United Kingdom]] |access-date=27 August 2015}}</ref> In July 2015, the [[Foreign and Commonwealth Office]] formally declared that "the UK has engaged with Saleh Muslim, co-leader of the Democratic Union Party (PYD)".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.parliament.uk/business/publications/written-questions-answers-statements/written-question/Lords/2015-06-25/HL846/|title=Syria:Written question - HL846|work=[[Foreign and Commonwealth Office]]|date=3 July 2015}}</ref> Since then, [[United Kingdom Special Forces]] are supporting the Syrian Democratic Forces in operations.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-36539723|title=Syria conflict: On the frontline in battle for IS-held Manbij|publisher=[[BBC]] |date=15 June 2016}}</ref> [[Democratic Union Party (Syria)|Democratic Union Party]] (PYD) co-chairperson [[Salih Muslim Muhammad|Salih Muslim]] was invited to speak in the British Parliament Parliament in 2015 and in 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://anfenglish.com/news/pyd-co-president-muslim-to-speak-at-uk-parliament|title=PYD co-president Muslim to speak at UK Parliament|agency=[[Firat News Agency]] |date=12 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/AylinaKilic/status/801084048525426688|title=Salih Muslim will hold a press statement on Turkey's arrest warrant at UK parliament|work=Aylina Kılıç on Twitter|date=22 November 2015}}</ref> [[File:US and YPG officers in northeastern Hasaka.png|thumb|Rojava's [[People's Protection Units]] and [[Women's Protection Units]] cooperate with Special Operations Forces of the U.S. and other nations in the fight against ISIL]] * {{Flagicon|United States}} '''[[United States]]''' – The [[US Department of State]] announced limited support for the PYD in February 2016,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/dpb/2016/02/252263.htm|title=US Department of State|date=8 February 2016|publisher=[[US Department of State]]}}</ref> although it opposes the unilateral establishment of a federal region in northern Syria.<ref name=system>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-35830375|title=Syria conflict: Kurds declare federal system|date=17 March 2016|publisher=[[BBC]]}}</ref> In March 2016, the day after the declaration of the Democratic Federation of Northern Syria, U.S. Defense Secretary [[Ashton Carter]] praised the YPG militia as having "proven to be excellent partners of ours on the ground in fighting ISIL. We are grateful for that, and we intend to continue to do that, recognizing the complexities of their regional role."<ref>{{cite web |title=Pentagon chief praises Kurdish fighters in Syria|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/pentagon-chief-praises-kurdish-fighters-in-syria.aspx?pageID=238&nID=96609&NewsCatID=352|work=[[Hürriyet Daily News]] |date=2016-03-18|accessdate=2016-06-13}}</ref> The USA have usually supported the YPG militia in its fight against ISIL, both with air support in combat and with embedded [[US Special Forces]]. During the [[Northern Raqqa offensive (May 2016)]], US Special Operation Forces were widely reported and photographed taking part, wearing YPG and YPJ badges on their uniforms.<ref>{{cite news|title=U.S. Troops 18 Miles from ISIS Capital|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2016/05/26/u-s-troops-18-miles-from-isis-capital.html|date=2016-05-27|accessdate=2016-05-27|agency=[[The Daily Beast]] }}</ref> When in June 2016 the [[Manbij offensive (2016)|Manbij offensive]] started, the ''[[Washington Post]]'' reported it under the headline of "Ignoring Turkey, U.S. backs Kurds in drive against ISIS in Syria".<ref>{{cite web |title=Ignoring Turkey, U.S. backs Kurds in drive against ISIS in Syria|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/us-backs-kurds-in-drive-against-isis-in-syria-despite-turkish-objections/2016/06/01/7bacf6fa-2808-11e6-8329-6104954928d2_story.html|work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=2016-06-01|accessdate=2016-06-03}}</ref> On 7 November 2016, when asked about the federalization of Syria, Mark C. Toner, the Deputy Spokesperson for the US Department of State, said "We don’t want to see any kind of ad hoc federalism or federalist system arise. We don’t want to see semi-autonomous zones. The reality is, though, as territory is liberated from Daesh, you got to get some kind of governance back into these areas, but by no means are we condoning or – any kind of, as I said, ad hoc semi-autonomous areas in northern Syria".<ref>{{cite web |title=Mark C. Toner, Deputy Spokesperson. Daily Press Briefing. Washington, DC. November 7, 2016|url=https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/dpb/2016/11/264175.htm|work=United States Department of State|date=2016-11-07|accessdate=2016-11-07}}</ref> According to [[lieutenant general]] [[Stephen J. Townsend]] of the [[United States Army]] in an interview on 29 March 2017, the US does not recognize the DFNS as a "Kurdish state" but instead sees it as a "[[Multiculturalism|multi-cultural]], [[Multi-party system|multi-party]], [[Multinational state|multi-ethnic]], multi-sectarian Syrian region being liberated from ISIS."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://komnews.com/us-gen-townsend-rebuffs-turkish-reporter-with-political-agenda-against-sdf/|title=US Gen. Townsend rebuffs Turkish reporter with ‘political agenda’ against SDF|work=Kom News|date=29 March 2017}}</ref> Effective 31 January 2018, the [[Syrian Democratic Council]] (SDC) is registered in the US as a "foreign political party" under the Foreign Agents Registration Act.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/syrian-kurds-apply-to-set-up-mission-in-washington-130649|title=Syrian Kurds apply to set up mission in Washington|publisher=Hurriyet Daily News|date=2018-04-20}}</ref>
=== Relations with international organisations ===
* {{flagicon image|Seal of Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve.svg|size=18px|border=}} '''[[Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve|CJTF–OIR]]''' – The US-led coalition against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) collaborates closely and comprehensively with the [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] (SDF).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/09/us-sending-arms-kurdish-led-sdf-syria-turkeys-erdogan-outraged/|title=US sending arms to Kurdish-led SDF in Syria, Turkey’s Erdogan outraged|work=[[ARA News]] |date=25 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.stripes.com/news/us-general-syrian-democratic-forces-will-lead-the-assault-on-raqqa-1.435953|website=[[Stars and Stripes (newspaper)]] |title=US general: Syrian Democratic Forces will lead the assault on Raqqa|date=26 October 2016}}</ref> * {{Flagicon|European Union}} '''[[European Union]]''' – In July 2016, the [[European Parliament]] drew much political attention with a photo exhibition dedicated to the DFNS.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://anfenglish.com/news/photo-exhibition-on-rojava-in-the-european-parliament|title=Photo exhibition on Rojava in the European Parliament|publisher=[[Firat News Agency]] |date=2016-07-12|accessdate=2016-07-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/07/australian-academic-turkish-govt-rojava-exhibit-not-pyd-propaganda-tool/|title=Austrian academic to Turkish govt: Rojava exhibit at EU Parliament is not PYD propaganda tool|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-07-13|accessdate=2016-07-14}}</ref> In September 2016, [[Democratic Union Party (Syria)|Democratic Union Party]] (PYD) co-chairperson [[Salih Muslim Muhammad|Salih Muslim]] was invited to address the European Parliament.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/09/pyd-leader-to-european-parliament-turkey-still-supporting-isis/|title=PYD leader to European Parliament: Turkey still supporting ISIS|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=3 September 2016}}</ref> * {{Flagicon|United Nations}} '''[[United Nations]]''' – While the DFNS administration is not invited to the [[Geneva peace talks on Syria (2016)|Geneva III peace talks on Syria]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-kurds-idUSKCN0YE2NI|title=Syrian Kurds point finger at Western-backed opposition|publisher=Reuters|date=2016-05-23|accessdate=2016-05-24}}</ref> or any of the earlier talks, Russia, which calls for their inclusion, does to some degree carry their positions into the talks, as documented in Russia's May 2016 draft for a new constitution for Syria.<ref name="Now.MMedia/Al-Akhbar"/> On 6 June 2016, the PYD said that the [[United Nations]] Syria envoy [[Staffan de Mistura]] sent a detailed letter to the PYD leadership with an invitation to the next round of talks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kurdistan24.net/en/news/6870f52d-5bad-4248-a34f-c7c4a75902bb/Syrian-Kurdish-PYD-involvement-confirmed-in-Geneva-talks|title=Syrian Kurdish PYD to participate in Geneva talks|publisher=[[Kurdistan 24]] |date=2016-06-06|accessdate=2016-06-06}}</ref> The [[United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees|Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees]] (UNHCR) co-operates refugee camps for inbound Syrian and Iraqi refugees in the DFNS, most notably the camp in [[Al-Hawl]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/11/thousands-iraqis-fleeing-mosul-cross-syria-161118140855259.html|title=Thousands of Iraqis fleeing Mosul 'cross into Syria'|publisher=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=18 October 2016}}</ref>
=== Relations with international civil society === {{See also|Libertarian socialism|Libertarian municipalism}} [[File:Wien - Kobane-Demo 2014-10-10 - V.jpg|thumb|Demonstration for solidarity with [[Rojava]], in [[Vienna]], 2014]] The socio-political transformations of the "Rojava Revolution" have inspired much attention in international media, both in mainstream media<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/29/magazine/a-dream-of-utopia-in-hell.html|title=A Dream of Secular Utopia in ISIS’ Backyard|publisher=[[The New York Times]] |date=2015-11-24|accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/2/50102294-77fd-11e5-a95a-27d368e1ddf7.html|title=Power to the people: a Syrian experiment in democracy|publisher=[[Financial Times]] |date=2015-10-23|accessdate=2016-06-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/30/opinion/the-kurds-democratic-experiment.html|title=The Kurds’ Democratic Experiment|publisher=[[The New York Times]] |date=2015-09-30|accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2014/oct/08/why-world-ignoring-revolutionary-kurds-syria-isis|title=Why is the world ignoring the revolutionary Kurds in Syria?|publisher=[[The Guardian]] |date=2014-10-08|accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref> and in dedicated [[Progressivism|progressive leftist]] media.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.opendemocracy.net/arab-awakening/jo-magpie/regaining-hope-in-rojava|title=Regaining hope in Rojava|publisher=[[openDemocracy]] |date=2016-06-06|accessdate=2016-06-09}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/xx_factor/2015/11/25/rojava_is_a_radical_experiment_in_democracy_in_northern_syria_american_leftists.html|title=American Leftists Need to Pay More Attention to Rojava|publisher=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]] |date=2015-11-25|accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dissentmagazine.org/online_articles/the-revolution-in-rojava|title=The Revolution in Rojava|website=[[Dissent (American magazine)]]|publisher=[[University of Pennsylvania Press]] |date=2015-04-22|accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.opendemocracy.net/arab-awakening/evangelos-aretaios/rojava-revolution|title=The Rojava revolution|publisher=[[openDemocracy]] |date=2015-03-15|accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://new-compass.net/articles/statement-academic-delegation-rojava|title=Statement from the Academic Delegation to Rojava|publisher=New Compass|date=2015-01-15|accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref>
Among the early established international [[non-governmental organizations]] (NGOs) active in the DFNS are [[Handicap International]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://helpkobane.com/blog/2015/05/28/handicap-international-finds-kobane-a-city-of-unexploded-weapons/|title=Handicap International finds Kobanê a city of unexploded weapons|publisher=HelpKobane|date=2015-05-28|accessdate=2016-06-22}}</ref> and [[DanChurchAid]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://helpkobane.com/blog/2015/05/07/danchurchaid-started-removing-remnants-of-unexploded-ammunition/|title=DanChurchAid started removing remnants of unexploded ammunition|publisher=HelpKobane|date=2015-05-07|accessdate=2016-06-22}}</ref> while many established NGOs are deterred by the aggressive Turkish embargo policy. However, there are numerous purpose-built initiatives of international support for Rojava and people in Rojava as well as a considerable amount of freelance volunteers. The international volunteers with the [[People's Protection Units|People's Protection Units (YPG)]] self-defence militia have been widely reported on,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.middleeasteye.net/news/lions-rojava-282706690/|title=US and British volunteers describe fighting with Kurds in Syria|publisher=[[Middle East Eye]] |date=2015-07-29|accessdate=2016-07-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/06/syrian-kurds-erect-monument-memory-foreign-fighters-fallen-war-isis/|title=Syrian Kurds erect monument in memory of foreign fighters fallen in war against ISIS|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-06-17|accessdate=2016-07-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/04/foreign-fighters-set-medical-unit-help-syrian-kurds/|title=Western volunteers set up Medical Unit in the DFNS to help Syrian Kurds in war on ISIS|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-04-30|accessdate=2016-07-10}}</ref> as to a lesser extent have the international volunteers with the DFNS Plan infrastructure-building initiative.<ref>{{cite news|title=Syrian Kurdish region witnessing campaign of ‘Organic Agriculture in Rojava’|url=http://aranews.net/2016/05/syrian-kurdish-region-witnessing-campaign-organic-agriculture-rojava/|accessdate=2016-05-16|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-07-10}}</ref>
By 2017, Turkish deterrence against international civil society engagement in the DFNS has been breaking down. From September 2017, [[Médecins Sans Frontières]] operates the National Hospital in [[Hasakah]], which had been abandoned by the Syrian government.<ref>{{cite news|title=The National Hospital in al-Hasaka is back to service after being sponsored by MSF|url=http://www.welat.fm/en/the-national-hospital-is-back-to-service-after-being-sponsored-by-msf/|date=2017-09-10|publisher=welat.fm}}</ref>
A number of international NGOs help to support huge number of refugees who have fled to Rojava from other parts of Syria or from Iraq, while trying to keep a low profile for the aforementioned reason.<ref>{{cite news|title=Syrian Kurds provide safe haven for thousands of Iraqis fleeing ISIS|url=http://aranews.net/2016/07/syrian-kurds-provide-safe-haven-thousands-iraqis-fleeing-isis/|accessdate=2016-07-02|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-07-10}}</ref>
== Foreign relations of DFNS regions == [[File:Seal of the Cizire Canton foreign relations board.png|thumb|Seal of the [[Jazira Region]]'s Foreign Relations Board]]
=== Jazira Region ===
In August 2016, the newly founded [[University of Rojava]] in [[Qamishli]], established by the [[Jazira Region]] Board of Education, concluded an agreement with [[Paris 8 University]] in [[France]] for cooperation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/08/rojava-university-seeks-eliminate-constraints-education-syrias-kurdish-region/|title=Rojava university seeks to eliminate constraints on education in Syria’s Kurdish region|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=2016-08-15|accessdate=2016-08-15}}</ref>
In 2016, talks about the establishment of a French cultural centre in the town of [[Amuda]] began.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lejdd.fr/Culture/Livres/L-ecrivain-Patrice-Franceschi-veut-creer-un-centre-culturel-au-Kurdistan-syrien-778553|title=L’écrivain Patrice Franceschi veut créer un centre culturel au Kurdistan syrien|publisher=[[Le Journal du Dimanche]] |date=27 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://aranews.net/2016/09/kurds-plan-set-french-institute-syria/|title=Kurds plan to set up French institute in Syria|publisher=[[ARA News]] |date=8 September 2016}}</ref>
=== Euphrates Region ===
In April 2015, the municipality of [[Rome]], capital of [[Italy]], recognised the municipality of [[Kobani]] as a [[sister city]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kurdishquestion.com/oldsite/index.php/kurdistan/west-kurdistan/rome-declares-kobane-sister-city.html|title=Rome Declares Kobane 'Sister City'|publisher=Kurdishquestion|date=2015-04-05|accessdate=2016-08-19}}</ref>
In September 2016, the [[Kurdish Red Crescent]] opened a hospital in Kobanî, their first hospital in the [[Euphrates Region]]. Many international organizations had given a helping hand as well as sending them special medical equipment, [[UNICEF]] and [[Doctors Without Borders]] in particular.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.hawarnews.com/krc-opens-the-first-hospital-in-kobani/|title=KRC opens the first hospital in Kobani|publisher=[[Hawar News Agency]]|date=2016-09-24|accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref>
=== Afrin Region ===
YPG spokesman Redur Xelil stated on 20 March 2017 that Russia will train Kurdish fighters under an agreement in which it will also set up a military base near Afrin. Russian troops and armored vehicles were reported to have been spotted around Afrin.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.alaraby.co.uk/english/news/2017/3/20/russia-to-train-kurdish-forces-at-north-syria-base|title=Russia to train Kurdish forces at north Syria base|publisher=The New Arab|date=2017-03-20|accessdate=2017-03-20}}</ref> Russia however denied any such deal was made, stating it had no plans to create additional military bases in Syria and adding that only a section of its reconciliation centre was located in [[Aleppo Governorate]] near Afrin for the prevention of ceasefire violations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/03/russia-strikes-deal-syrian-kurds-set-base-170320142545942.html|title=Russia strikes deal with Syrian Kurds to set up base|publisher=Al-Jazeera|date=2017-03-20|accessdate=2017-03-20}}</ref>
